title: Hungry Horse Test 1 (Live Low Stakes Test)
description: Based off of '99% of Players FAIL This Poker IQ Test' video by hungry horse poker

scenario.description: A weak player in the cut off open raises. The two players behind are strong players.

solution.hint: The players behind you are strong. The player before you is weak. Do you see any options that would allow you to play more often against the weaker player and avoid action with stronger players?
solution.explanation: With two regs behind, we should 3-bet raise to isolate the pot with the fish when we have position.

scenario.description: Passive player who is limping often raises.

solution.hint: By limping many of the hands they should be raising with, this leaves their raising range to be even stronger.
solution.explanation: Considering that the player is limping more often than they should, we should expect their raising range to be pretty strong. Therefore, we want to fold since 9h8h is not strong enough to compete with their range.

solution.hint: Your hand has the potential to make a big hand(straights and flushes), but is probably losing to most of your opponents' calling range.
solution.explanation: Considering the stack depth, calling is appropriate at this price. If the flop is favorable, we can continue, otherwise we can quickly fold.

scenario.description: Reg in the LJ raises. All the players behind are fish.

solution.hint: With so many weak players behind, we want them to join in. Our hand is not at the top of our range.
solution.explanation: With many weak players behind, we want to call to keep those plaers in considering our hand is not strong enough to 3-bet raise against the strong reg.
